additional_details:
I want the Government to make IVF more accessible for all. If you can’t have kids naturally you should be offered help, regardless if it’s your first or second child. Couples are being penalised for having a medical issue that prevents them extending there family.
 
Out of all infertility causes, secondary infertility makes up about 50 percent of all cases. More needs to be done.
openai_explanation: Fund 3 rounds of IVF for all couples who cannot conceive naturally.

action: Introduce a national fishing line recycling scheme
background: 400 million metres of fishing line is discarded in the UK each year. It takes 600 years for heavy monofilament to degrade.
additional_details:
Fishing litter and discarded nets cause injury and death to thousands of wild animals every year.
 
We need the Government to introduce a national scheme to address this.
 
I want the government to:
 
1. Require material on fishing line recycling is provided whenever someone buys an EA fishing licence.
 
2. Provide funding for fishing line recycling bins in local parks and other open access fisheries such as canals, rivers and sea venues. Anywhere someone can fish, there should be a recycling bin.
 
3. Provide funding for recycling schemes, like the Anglers National Line Recycling Scheme, so these can be expanded to assist in the recycling of line, nets and all plastics collected both in freshwater and marine environments.
openai_explanation: Introduce a national fishing line recycling scheme to reduce the amount of fishing line discarded into the environment.

action: Create a wildlife corridor in place of HS2
background: This wildlife belt - a 330 mile long stretch of woodlands, hedgerows, wetlands, orchards and meadows - would be the UK's longest nature reserve and have a massive impact on nature recovery across the UK, serving as a conservation area, a critical link between distant habitats and a living seed bank.
additional_details: We are in the midst of a pandemic, witnessing an extinction of plant and animal species on an unprecedented scale and heading towards a climate catastrophe. Saving lives, protecting and regenerating natural habitats, supporting local economies – all are a matter of urgency and must be given priority over hugely expensive, long term infrastructure projects that are bound to fail the test of time. Further costs, destruction and CO2 emissions needed to complete HS2 works cannot be justified.
openai_explanation: Create a wildlife corridor in place of HS2 to create a nature reserve and help nature recovery.

action: Suspend any MPs accused of sexual offences pending investigations
background: Given the number of allegations occurring of a serious nature we believe there is the need for any MP or Minister formally accused of sexual offences to be suspended from the House, and any ministerial posts, pending the conclusion of all relevant investigations.
additional_details:
To establish a formal process whereby any MP or Minister is suspended immediately from the House and any ministerial posts, pending completion of all relevant investigations - by the police, government or parliamentary authorities - so as to safeguard the public, and others within Parliament and Government.
 
The removal of an MP against whom allegations of this kind are made should not be a personal choice after a formal allegation is made, but a requirement.
openai_explanation: Suspend any MPs accused of sexual offences pending investigations.

action: Require health warnings at point of purchase of fossil fuel energy eg. petrol
background: Air pollution damages our lungs, hearts and brains; causing 40,000 premature deaths and £20 billion in costs every year in the UK.
additional_details:
Burning fossil fuels is a major cause of both air pollution and climate change. It is a public right to understand the dangers of fossil fuels, just as it is for tobacco.

Emerging evidence suggests air pollution worsens covid19 outcomes. Health warnings connect the abstract threat of climate change with the vast array of health risks linked to fossil fuels. They should encourage use of alternatives to fossil fuels, and increase demand for zero-carbon renewable energy. Making fossil fuel use more of a public concern should inspire improvements to cycling and public transport networks, car sharing, EV charging stations and city planning.
openai_explanation: Require health warnings at point of purchase of fossil fuel energy to reduce air pollution.

action: Do not instate any form of a National Road pricing scheme in the UK
background: There are already ever increasing taxes on motorists, be it at the petrol/diesel pump or the annual Vehicle Excise duty, we do not need another tax imposed, especially not a per mile charge and with a black box tracking every mile driven.
additional_details:
Do not instate any plans for a per mile driven charge for motorists. (potentially known as a National Road Pricing Scheme).

Suggesting that the first 3,000 miles are free then you are charged per mile is just as bad. We pay enough motoring tax already.

This has nothing to do with the environment; the 40bn deficit in tax from fuel duty is precisely because the public have taken up greener forms of transport such as electric vehicles. This is simply because you want to fill the deficit.
openai_explanation: Do not instate any form of a National Road pricing scheme in the UK.

action: We demand that the UK Government declares a Global Climate Emergency
background: The UK Government is still the President of COP26. In spite of the progress made at the COP26 conference, global temperatures are rising faster than expected and emissions continue to rise unabated.  It is our moral obligation as COP President to declare a Global Climate Emergency.
additional_details:
The Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) report published on 28th Feb 2022 makes clear that climate change is impacting the world far faster than scientists had anticipated. Countries have failed to rein in planet-warming carbon emissions, which continue to rise.
"Unchecked carbon pollution is forcing the world's most vulnerable on a frogmarch to destruction...The facts are undeniable. This abdication of leadership is criminal." U.N. Secretary-General Antonio Guterres.
openai_explanation: This petition is related to climate change, carbon emissions, and environmental protection.

action: Urge the UN to Send a Human Rights Envoy to Jammu Kashmir
background: There is concern over vociferous allegations and reports of human rights violations in the disputed territory of Jammu Kashmir. These include: jailing Kashmiri leaders; human rights defenders; journalists; physical, emotional and mental torture; rape; youths shot; thousands missing; homes destroyed.
additional_details: The United Nations was set up to preserve human rights and promote global citizenship. The UK was a founding member and is a holding member. It is incumbent upon us all to stand up for the rights, articles, charters, resolutions and regulations enshrined in the UN charter to maintain international peace and uphold international law. We must promote universal respect for human rights. These alleged brutalities cannot be ignored therefore we call upon UK government to act to sustain global goals.
openai_explanation: This petition is related to human rights and has nothing to do with the environment.

action: Publish a comprehensive report into UFO and UAP events in the UK
background: The government should commission a comprehensive report, collating all the pertinent information from military and civilian records, relating to reports of UFO (unidentified flying objects) or UAP (unidentified aerial phenomena) which have taken place within the UK and which remain unexplained.
additional_details:
UAP and UFO events may be recorded by a number of different military or civilian authorities, via personnel or public reports, radar, missile detection systems or other equipment. This precludes the opportunity to collate and compare for analysis any pattern of events which may be useful in determining the nature and origin of events which remain unexplained.

UK citizens should be informed.
openai_explanation: This petition is related to UFO sightings and has nothing to do with the environment.

action: Regulate wildlife food so it’s safer for our UK hedgehogs, mammals & birds
background: Wildlife food isn’t regulated. Anything can be in the food & sold to the public as suitable. But it could be harmful, of poor quality, even fatal or not nutritionally correct. We request a team be set up to agree on safe, nutritious food, specially designed for all our UK hedgehogs, mammals & birds.
additional_details: UK wildlife is depleting fast with destruction of habitats & climate crisis. It is more important now than ever to give a helping hand before it disappears completely. The State of Nature Report says that hedgehogs have declined more than 50%, 25% of UK mammals & 50% of birds are at risk of extinction. We need help to get wildlife food regulated. The general public are willing to help but need to be able to provide good quality food to actually improve outcomes for our UK wildlife.
openai_explanation: This petition is related to wildlife and environmental protection.

action: Review the safety, environmental and wildlife impact of reservoirs
background: In February our lovely dogs, Coco and Spotty, perished in a local farm reservoir. It was not fenced and had a new polypropylene lining which means that, when wet, it is so slippery it is impossible for anyone (human or animal) to climb out.
additional_details:
The Government should:

- Commission research into the safest, most effective, most environmentally-friendly and most wildlife-friendly way to capture and store rainwater on farms.

- Require land owners to add secure perimeters to their reservoirs such as cargo netting or fencing.

- Ensure all water resource management grants include ring-fenced funding for robust health and safety measures
openai_explanation: This petition is related to water pollution and environmental protection.

action: Control pollution from agriculture in the Wye and Severn River Catchments
background:
1. Introduce an immediate moratorium of any new intensive poultry units in the Wye and Severn catchment areas
2. Strictly control manure spreading according to the phosphate load in the ground 
3. Monitor phosphate levels
4. Take legal action against any breaches of pollution legislation
additional_details: Water quality and biodiversity has declined in both rivers in recent years because of high levels of nitrates and phosphates leading algae blooms. This has lead to a significant loss  in biodiversity. Pollution from agricultural run off in particular that from from intensive poultry units (IPUs) is the single most important cause of the increased pollution in these river systems. Stringent control of pollution from farms is urgently needed to prevent an ecological catastrophe.
openai_explanation: This petition is related to pollution and environmental protection.

action: Impose stricter requirements on reallocation of road space by local authorities
background: The Government should require councils undertake full consultations and equality assessments that engage with the emergency services, the disabled, businesses & residents impacted by traffic displacement before reallocating road space or implementing Low traffic Neighbourhoods.
additional_details:
The Traffic Management Act places a duty on councils to ensure traffic moves freely and quickly on their roads and those of nearby authorities. We believe some road schemes displace and slow traffic, causing significant congestion, increased idling & reduced air quality. Congestion can also delay emergency vehicles potentially causing risk to life. These impacts can disproportionately affect the disabled, the BAME community, small businesses & low paid workers who rely on vehicles.

Increasing requirements for consultation and assessing the impact of proposed road schemes, with financial penalties for failing to do so, would ensure such schemes do not go ahead unless they would be beneficial. Existing schemes should be required to meet these new requirements or be removed.
openai_explanation: This petition is related to traffic and has nothing to do with the environment.

action: Ban all single use plastic
background: I want there to be a ban on all single use plastic e.g. plastic packaging for fruit and veg, plastic bottles, plastic on cans of alcohol, plastic bags in supermarkets because half of these things end up in land fill sights, oceans and on land in places where animals inhabit.
additional_details: I’m very passionate about the environment and I want serious change to be made to the way in which things are packaged as their are many animals that are being killed and fooled by plastic in oceans and on land. Plastic is ridiculously bad for the environment and needs to be banned urgently. We need change in this country in the way in which things are packaged and there are so many alternatives to single use plastic.
openai_explanation: This petition is related to plastic pollution and environmental protection.

action: Remove Dominican Republic from Red List countries
background:
Remove the Dominican Republic from the Red List countries to allow Dominicans and relatives to visit family in the DR without having to quarantine.

As of 27/8/21, daily confirmed cases per million people in DR are 25.2 vs 499.5 (almost 20x) in the UK (https://ourworldindata.org/covid-cases)
additional_details:
According to GISAID (Tracking of Variants) only 1 Delta variant has been recorded in DR vs 257,322 only in England. Almost 42% of DR population is fully vaccinated vs 25% of Australia (Green) or nearly 5% of Jamaica (Amber). 

Most DR data is (favourably) comparable with Green/Amber light countries like Germany, Canada, Switzerland, Spain, USA and Australia, then why deny taxpayers citizens and residents their right to visit their families in Dominican Republic?
openai_explanation: This petition is related to travel and has nothing to do with the environment.

action: Allow the flying of Suffrage flag as a symbol of women's equality
background: Since its introduction in 1908, the Suffrage flag of the Women's Social and Political Union has attained iconic status as a symbol of women's equality. Catalogued under WOA T52 of the Parliamentary Collection, it deserves the same legal recognition granted to e.g. the Rainbow and NHS flags.
additional_details:
This petition calls for an amendment to the Town and Country Planning (Control of Advertisements) Regulations. A new category of flag should be added to those recognised as having the deemed consent of the local planning authority to be flown:

* the Suffrage flag (three horizontal equal stripes of purple, white and green).

This would place the flag alongside the Rainbow and NHS flags as a mark of civic pride, formally recognising and celebrating an integral part of British history.
openai_explanation: This petition is related to women's rights and has nothing to do with the environment.

action: Allow 'Personal Electric Vehicles' to use cycle lanes and walkways.
background: Allow the responsible use of personally owned electric vehicles with speed / power restrictions on cycle lanes and walkways. I would like to see similar access to that which is allowed mobility scooters on public walkways and cycle lanes. Is a mobility aid for the able too much to ask?
additional_details: Given the global uptake on the use of personal electric vehicles such as scooters, unicycles, onewheels and the numerous segway type devices I believe it is something inevitable and needs legalisation. There are numerous stories of people replacing their polluting car journeys with the greener, healthier, outdoor option of the personal electric vehicle and often completing their journey in half the time travelling at half the speed. I myself have been a lot more active since owning a PEV.
openai_explanation: This petition relates to climate change, air pollution, water pollution, and active travel.

action: Publish new carbon budgets linked to the Paris Agreement and Climate Change Act
background: In the light of the high court ruling of 26th February 2020 on the proposed expansion of Heathrow airport, the UK govt must now publish new carbon budgets, linked to its commitments under the Paris agreement and the 2008 climate change act.
additional_details:
The high court judgement stated that govt “must include an explanation of how the policy set out in the statement takes account of Government policy relating to the mitigation of, and adaptation to, climate change"
 
It made reference to relevant parts of the Paris agreement and other UK statutes
 
In my opinion, a carbon budget for infrastructure spending in the UK may now be required. Because all new projects are now open to challenge based on their inability to sit within carbon emission limits
openai_explanation: This petition relates to carbon emissions, climate change, and the Paris Agreement.

action: Increase funding for flood defences for East Anglia
background:
We need the Government to provide funding to ensure that infrastructure designed to drain & protect East Anglia from flooding is restored and improved to its full capability.
 
The system must be capable of dealing with the pressures of the 21st century & the future challenges from global warming.
additional_details:
The threat of flood is real. As seen in December 2020: Homes were flooded, businesses were shut, national infrastructure was closed (A14), people evacuated from their homes and businesses and wildlife habitats destroyed.
 
If this issue is not addressed with urgency this is a man-made disaster waiting to happen. If the flood defences cannot express the surge of water quick enough the defences shall be breached and flooding of a great economic and humanitarian will happen. Action is needed now.
openai_explanation: This petition relates to water pollution, climate change, and flooding.

action: Tax 50% of the Energy Companies profits to help households pay bills.
background: The petition is to get MPs to debate that energy companies profits which are billions of pounds should be taxed at 50% from their profits to help UK households pay their energy bills.
openai_explanation: This petition does not relate to the environment.

action: Ban fossil fuel sponsorship of all UK culture, media and sport
background: Companies are using the sponsorship of culture, media and sport to greenwash their reputations, buying the social licence they need to continue profiting from the destruction of the planet. This activity threatens our collective future and it needs to be banned.
additional_details: To meet the Paris Agreement goals of keeping global temperature rises beneath 1.5 degrees, we need a rapid transition away from fossil fuels, based on far-reaching changes to every aspect of our lives. Companies that have a financial interest in slowing this process cannot be given a seat at the table. Petrochemical majors have stifled climate action for decades and they continue to do so today. Like tobacco companies, they must be prevented from laundering their reputations through sponsorship.
openai_explanation: This petition relates to air pollution and climate change.

action: Increase statutory protections for protected trees and listed parks
background: Protected trees and grade listed parks should be afforded statutory protections equivalent to grade-listed buildings.
additional_details:
Protected trees and grade listed parks should be afforded the same protection as grade listed buildings. There are significant sanctions against persons when the protected status of a tree has been violated. However, local authorities can give permission for trees subject to preservation orders to be cut down, and there are no statutory protections for listed parks.

The Government should increase the rights of trees and grade listed parks, to prevent their protection being removed when a local authority so desires. The environment, especially in urban areas is under constant threat because of development. However, nature should be made foremost in all planning decisions in order to protect our environment. Development working in harmony with nature must be the way for future progress.
openai_explanation: This petition relates to wildlife and protected trees.

action: Make it illegal to chain or tether a dog
background:
Make it against the law for a dog to be tied up, whether the dog is being chained up or tethered.
 
No dog should be tied up for hours on end, as restricting a dog’s freedom to move can be damaging to a dog’s health, wellbeing and ability to properly socialise with humans and animals.
additional_details:
Dogs are naturally social creatures who thrive on interaction with humans and other animals. Dogs tied up in one spot can suffer psychological damage.
 
It can also lead to injuries, and even death as it is possible for a dog to hang itself if the chain/tether is caught up something high.
openai_explanation: This petition does not relate to the environment.

action: Reject any future applications to increase passenger numbers at Luton Airport
background: Luton Council are consulting on increasing passenger numbers from 18 to 32million per year as a preliminary step for an application for a Development Consent Order (DCO). We call upon the UK Government to refuse any future application to increase the number of passengers using London Luton Airport.
additional_details:
This expansion of airport capacity is surely contrary to the recommendations of the Committee on Climate Change.

The airport (LLA) doubled its capacity between 2014 and 2019, creating immense strain on local transport infrastructure, unbearable noise impacts on neighbouring communities and increased greenhouse gas emissions.

Now LLA wants to almost double its capacity from 18 million passengers a year to 32 million, despite the Climate Emergency and the impact the increase in flights will surely have on the environment.
openai_explanation: This petition relates to air pollution, climate change, and emissions.

action: Make the wearing of Cycle Helmets for children under 16 Law
background: We are all families that have been brought together by the distressing experience of having our children involved in serious road traffic collisions while cycling.
additional_details: The children who had worn Cycle Helmets sustained significantly less head trauma as opposed to those not wearing a helmet which resulted in TBI (traumatic brain injury)
openai_explanation: This petition does not relate to the environment.

action: Ban production and export of pesticides already banned for use within the UK
background: The UK is Europe’s biggest exporter of pesticides banned for use in the EU. An Unearthed and Public Eye investigation found that the UK exports 32,188 tonnes of banned pesticides (almost 40% of the total from the EU) and that much ends up in poorer countries like South Africa, Ukraine, and Brazil.
additional_details: We cannot allow chemical manufacturers within the UK to profit from the production and export of banned pesticides. Chemicals have been banned for use within the UK due to potential health hazards like reproductive failure, endocrine disruption or cancer, and environmental hazards like groundwater contamination or poisoning of fish, birds, mammals or bees. The Government should ensure such chemicals are not produced in the UK or exported from the UK to other countries.
openai_explanation: This petition relates to water pollution, pesticides, and wildlife.

action: Protect the UK’s countryside and coast from post-lockdown damage
background: The Government should fund nationwide and sustained countryside public behaviour messaging and education including: messaging ahead of the current lockdown ending, an ongoing campaign directed at staycationers, and a sustained education initiative, thus creating a lasting legacy.
additional_details:
Remember the almost daily news headlines and images of how our natural beauty spots were being abused?

The 2020 hit-and-run approach for holidays had a serious, negative effect on the countryside and coastline with mass littering, fly-camping, graffiti and fire being caused by visitors simply unaware of the impact they were having. We earnestly do not want a repeat of this for the upcoming season as delicate environments cannot sustain the level of degradation they received last year.
openai_explanation: Not enviromental in nature

action: Nationalise energy companies
background: The Government should take all energy companies back into public ownership to help address the living crisis, as many working people cannot afford it.
additional_details: If this carries on there will be an uproar. The Government cannot possibly believe the public are going to keep accepting the price hikes. If nothing is done soon I worry there will be civil unrest and increased crime. This should ease the burdens and pressures families already face. We should not be living just to work, we should be working to live.
openai_explanation: Not enviromental in nature

action: Work with international community to end conflict between Azerbaijan and Armenia
background:
We would like the UK government to work with other countries and international bodies in brokering a resolution of the current conflict between Azerbaijan and Armenia.

To ensure the immediate withdrawal of Armenian troops from Nagorno-Karabakh and ensuring the territorial integrity of Azerbaijan.
additional_details:
As the UK is a major investor and beneficiary of the natural resources of Azerbaijan and an influential member in global politics, it has the ability to highlight the current dangerous escalation of violence and military action in the region.

This is significant as this could end with serious destabilisation in the region; it will cost lives and potentially end with both countries losing control of the current COVID-19 pandemic which could conclude with catastrophic consequences.
openai_explanation: Not enviromental in nature

action: Ban the sale of disposable vapes.
background: A recent innovation in vape technology, the disposable vape is becoming increasingly popular & is already one of the most frequent items of litter. These single-use plastics are now routinely found lying in the street, concealed amongst vegetation, floating in watercourses & on coastal strandlines.
additional_details: By outlawing the sale of disposable vapes the UK Government and Parliament can nip in the bud a new and rapidly increasing form of single use plastic pollution.
openai_explanation: Ban the sale of disposable vapes to reduce plastic pollution

action: Ban use and sale of non-silent fireworks
background: Why can't we learn from 20/21 New Year when there were laser and light displays and silent firework displays only? This should ensure that celebrations do not cause nuisance that can cause upset and trauma to pets, military veterans and sensitive children.
additional_details:
It is really an awful time for our wildlife, livestock, pets, military veterans and sensitive children at this time of year.
Not only is it about everyone's safety and well-being, it's also about every animals well-being.
We are supposed to be a nation of animal lovers.
openai_explanation: Ban the use and sale of non-silent fireworks to reduce noise pollution

action: Make electric scooters legal to reduce our carbon footprint / cut emissions
background: Make electric scooters legal, by doing this we will make people’s commute easier and reduce the carbon footprint. This is a big issue and something has to be done. They are similar to bikes: they are easy to control and compact so can be picked up and carried.
openai_explanation: Make electric scooters legal to reduce carbon emissions and cut pollution

action: Scrap RIS2 (Road Investment Strategy 2)
background: In the middle of a climate emergency, we shouldn't be building and upgrading 4,000 miles of new roads. Roads produce very high amounts of carbon emissions. We need to invest less in more polluting roads and more in other greener modes of transport like rail.
additional_details: Even with electric vehicles, roads still cause high emissions and damage the environment both to build and while they're in use. E.g. tyre particulates have been found to damage the environment. The use of electric vehicles shouldn't be used as an argument to carry on building roads in this fashion.
openai_explanation: Scrap RIS2 to reduce carbon emissions and cut pollution

action: Ban the Advertising of Meat Products
background: Ban or restrict advertising in the media of products containing meat such as beef, pork, poultry and fish in order to reduce the demand for and consumption of meat and animal products. Reducing our meat consumption as a nation will benefit public health and our environment.
additional_details: A recent UN report has said that lesser consumption of animal products is crucial to save the world from the worst impacts of climate change. Livestock and their byproducts contribute to greenhouse gas emissions and have been associated with risks of disease spreading. Eating meat has been shown to increase risk of heart disease, cancer, strokes and obesity. Reducing our meat consumption as a nation will benefit public health and our environment.
openai_explanation: Ban the advertising of meat products to reduce pollution and animal consumption

action: Require police disclose & allow reported Non-Crime Hate Incidents be challenged
background: Impose a statutory duty on each police force to give notice to individuals when Non-Crime Hate Incidents are recorded against them, and give them an opportunity to challenge the allegations within 28 days, with a right of appeal to the court, so that these reports can be deleted if unfounded.
additional_details: At the moment the police have recorded around 120,000 Non-Crime Hate Incidents. These are often not fully investigated. They are however recorded following a report by someone who experienced the incident as "hateful". These Incidents can be disclosed to potential employers on enhanced DBS checks, affecting employability. Often this is the first time it is revealed to the "perpetrator". This is a breach of the principle of natural justice.
openai_explanation: Not enviromental in nature

action: Prevent all new North Sea oil and gas exploration
background: We want the Government to take all action necessary to prevent new North Sea oil and gas exploration. This includes preventing new licences being granted as a result of the current Offshore Licensing Round, and revoking powers for any new licenses for exploration to be granted.
openai_explanation: Prevent all new North Sea oil and gas exploration to reduce air pollution

action: To Put Morocco on the Green list of countries and territories
background: We would like the government to put Morocco on the Green list just like the other countries that were added on the 24th of June 2021.
additional_details: We want the government to put Morocco on the Green list because data show low rates of deaths and they are controlling their borders really well. Many people want to go to Morocco for a holiday because it’s a popular country and many people have already booked to go. As Morocco is controlling the COVID pandemic well, having to quarantine for 10 days is a lot and many people need to come back to work and school.
openai_explanation: This petition is enviromental in nature as it focuses on Morocco's green list and carbon emissions.

action: Make the catering at the Glasgow 2021 UN Climate Change Conference plant-based
background: The 2019 IPCC report 'Climate Change and Land' notes that a shift towards a plant-based diet can offer significant benefits in mitigating climate change. We are asking the UK Government as hosts of the Conference to show their commitment to the conference aims by making the food offered plant-based.
additional_details:
Disappointingly, previous UN Climate Change conferences have offered very little plant-based foods and COP26 presents an opportunity for the UK government to set a global example in Glasgow, one of most vegan-friendly cities in the world. 

The IPCC Special Report 'Climate Change and Land', 2019, p497. 'For example, halving consumption of meat, dairy products and eggs in the European Union would achieve a 40% reduction in ammonia emissions, 25–40% reduction in non-CO2 GHG emissions...'
openai_explanation: This petition is enviromental in nature as it focuses on plant-based catering for the UN Climate Change Conference.

action: Ban new incinerator and pyrolysis sites and invest in waste reduction
background: We want the government to follow the example set in the EU by banning any new incinerators for the purpose of waste disposal. They should also ban pyrolysis facilities, and instead seek the solutions we need to reduce waste completely by investing in waste reduction, reuse and recycling.
additional_details:
Unfortunately waste management companies are benefitting from not having to pay similar taxes to that which are imposed on land-fill.

Communities across the breadth of the UK have campaigned against waste incinerators as many do not want one in their town or city.

The reasons for this are clear:

1) Incinerators risk harm to the health of local residents
2) Incinerators can pollute the air with toxic emissions
3) Incinerator emissions contribute to global warming
4) Incinerators can harm the environment
openai_explanation: This petition is enviromental in nature as it focuses on banning new incinerator and pyrolysis sites and investing in waste reduction.

action: Traffic to stop and wait for a stopped school bus loading or unloading children.
background: I would like the traffic laws to adopt a system where it is illegal to overtake a stopped school bus. Drivers should wait behind any stopped school transport bus where children are boarding or alighting to protect children from being hit by overtaking vehicles.
additional_details:
My daughter and her older brother use a designated school transport bus everyday. 

On the 10th October 2022 the bus had a different driver and he went a different route into our estate dropping the children on the opposite side of the road to their usual drop off point. My daughter was the first one off the bus and checking the road she deemed it safe to cross, however she didn't see from behind the bus an overtaking van and was hit at nearly 40mph. She sustained serious injuries.
openai_explanation: This petition is not enviromental in nature as it focuses on traffic laws and protecting children.

action: Approve the Whitehaven Coal Mine in Cumbria
background: World coal production is 8 billion tonnes. China alone produces 3.5 billion tonnes. The new colliery will produce around 4m tonnes of coal for steel making and should replace imported coal. It would close in 2049 and will provide the steel needed by the UK to comply with UK environmental targets.
additional_details: The Whitehaven mine will be built on a brown field site in an existing coal mining area. Approval for the mine was won after after agreement to comply with many environmental stipulations. The coal would not be burned but used in steel-making. It should provide over 2,000 local jobs and support UK exports and the economy. This steel will be needed to support environmental projects such as wind turbines and public transport networks such as rail links. This is a green project.
openai_explanation: This petition is not enviromental in nature as it focuses on the approval of a coal mine.

action: Change law to mean that if an adult discovers a dead body it must be reported
background: At the moment, if a person finds the body of someone deceased, they are under no obligation to report this to the police. This means a body could be left for days, weeks etc. and remain undiscovered.
additional_details: I think this should already be law, and even if it’s in a home environment this does not need to be reported as per the law right now.
openai_explanation: This petition is not enviromental in nature as it focuses on changing a law regarding dead bodies.

action: Protect the Environment – support carbon neutral energy alternatives
background:
In November 2019, Members of the UK Youth Parliament, sitting in the House of Commons voted “Protect the Environment” as its campaigning priority for this year.

We are calling for the Government to ban fracking, end the mining of fossil fuels and instead support carbon neutral energy alternatives.
additional_details:
To preserve this world for the next generation, we have a moral responsibility to protect it from the effects of Climate Change. Climate change is a problem than will affect young people more than any other generation.

Right now, the Government are not protecting the environment in the way that is necessary for young people and the next generation.

http://www.ukyouthparliament.org.uk/2019/news/climate-emergency-declared-biggest-issue-facing-young-people/
openai_explanation: This petition is enviromental in nature as it focuses on banning fracking and investing in carbon neutral energy alternatives.

action: Require developers felling trees to fund reforestation projects
background:
Tree growth is an effective means of trapping carbon dioxide, a greenhouse gas. The UK has one of the lowest forested areas in Europe.

Mature trees are lost in housing and infrastructure development.

We want Parliament to legislate to ensure these trees are adequately replaced.
additional_details:
New forests absorb carbon dioxide, help biodiversity and help the UK to meet its carbon footprint target.

At present, a mature tree lost in the course of a development is replaced, if at all, by a sapling on site. The net loss of carbon trapping is detrimental to the local environment and the atmosphere.

There would be a formula whereby the funding for replacement saplings depends on the size of the tree lost. 

The national and global benefits of more forestation will accrue wherever it is done.

background:
Explore options, and/or work with the French Government, to protect/save international rail travel.

We're asking you to consider exploring support options along with the French government to protect international rail travel, in a similar way to that given to the UK's rail and Airline companies.
additional_details:
Due to the Covid-19 pandemic Eurostar International are in a dire financial situation, which could risk the future of international rail travel. Services are been cut to the minimum of one per day, staff have been made redundant, stations have been closed etc. The possibility of the end of high speed international travel now seems very real.

Eurostar, for example, offer a unique alternative to international travel, which creates thousands of jobs and is better for the environment. HS1 is due to become the first UK railway to be powered by renewable energy, there is a great future for Eurostar, for all of us, if Eurostar International and international rail travel in general can survive this. Thank you.

action: Increase Statutory Maternity Pay in line a 40 hours week on minimum wage
background: Statutory Maternity Pay (SMP) is currently set at £151. 20 a week, which is not enough to meet the cost of life in the UK and the added costs of providing for a baby, especially for families on low incomes. Government should increase SMP to allow all children to have the best start in life.
additional_details: The early years are a vulnerable time when children’s experiences and environments can negatively influence their development. Growing up in poverty has a long lasting impact on children's development, school attainment and health. Children in more deprived areas are more likely to face a serious illness during childhood and to have a long-term disability. The current SMP puts an added strain on single mothers and families on low incomes and negatively affects the life of their children.

action: Prepare & deliver a strategy for developing and using Tidal energy in the UK
background: To develop a comprehensive strategy to use Tidal energy across the UK. Offer grants to support tidal arrays or tidal farms to help businesses develop a reliable 24/7 renewable energy.
additional_details:
To reduce carbon emissions energy needs to be produced without using fossil fuels - tidal energy can help do this.
 
The UK has developed a renewable industry based predominantly on bioenergy, solar & wind power. The UK still relies on energy from fossil fuels in addition up to importing energy via interconnectors. The UK has an underused resource around the country. Tide should be used to a greater extent than it is. Grants should be given to help business develop this resource. The UK could develop technologies supporting jobs & allow an export market to be developed for British businesses.

action: Create a nationwide network of pollinator passages, to form The Bee Superhighway
background: We want the government to highlight, promote and support the importance of creating pollinator networks nationwide. A super highway for pollinators that connects landscapes ward by ward, borough by borough, county by county and region by region, thus building a network of habitats for pollinators.
additional_details:
A third of British wild bees and pollinators are in decline. If current trends continue, some species will be lost from Britain indefinitely.
Pollination is mutually beneficial to plants and pollinators. Pollinators are an essential component of the habitats and ecosystem that we and many animals rely on for food, shelter and well-being. This network, The Bee Superhighway, will foster that and help the long term sustainability of food production and wildlife livelihood and we must encourage it.

action: Ban trail hunting on Ministry of Defence property
background: The National Trust has recently said it will no longer offer licences for trail hunting on their properties. We believe the Ministry of Defence should do the same.
additional_details: Trail hunts involve people on foot or horseback following a scent along a pre-determined route with hounds or beagles, but in practice wild animals including foxes are sometimes chased and killed during these hunts. Trail hunts should no longer be permitted on Ministry of Defence land, to ensure that wild animals, as well as the horses and dogs used for these hunts, do not suffer.

background: The Government should exempt new car/van/motorbike/trucks that use sustainable fuels from the 2030 petrol and diesel new car sales ban. Vehicles that use fuels from sustainable sources should be exempt from the ban to help reduce pollution & overall emissions faster.

action: UK Government to build UK Aid/Disaster Relief and Training Ship/s
background:
To regenerate the UK shipbuilding Industry by building Ship/s to directly deliver UK Aid. 

To provide a training platform to give work experience to future generations of UK & Commonwealth mariners. 

To equip the ships to deliver ocean advocacy, medical support and environmental research.
additional_details:
The UK has no means of directly addressing disaster relief except by the secondment of RN and RFA Ships of limited capability. There is currently no means to directly deliver UK Aid and community regeneration to UK overseas territories and the Commonwealth. These ships will be a world first in directly addressing the consequences of climate change whilst providing a practical face to COP26. 

The UK faces a significant challenge in finding enough ships to deliver the practical seagoing experience required by individual seafarers to comply with International legislation. 

The ships will be income generating and will be the face of UK Aid in providing a robust response to the environmental challenges of the future.

action: Require Water Companies to Refund Customers When They Dump Sewage
background: It’s a consumer rights and pollution issue. We pay for the water company to take away surface-foul water to be treated at local sewage works. This amounts to around 45-50% of our annual bill. If the companies dump that waste water into the river or sea, without treatment, they are ripping us off.
additional_details: Water companies have dumped sewage into rivers or the sea for years. Even in the height of summer during periods of low rainfall. It is more profitable for them to occasionally sluice the sewage, when they think they can get away with it, rather than treating it. If they were not just fined for any illegal dumping but forced to refund for treatment they haven’t done, it may make them a little more hesitant to carry on this disgusting practice.

action: Exempt CO2 neutral Efuel & other cleaner fuel cars from 2030 petrol & diesel ban
background: Government should allow the sale & future development of cars running on cleaner fuels such as higher bioethanol content E12 up to E85, & CO2 neutral Biomethane to cut CO2 & other emissions. Allow the sale past year 2030 of these cars going forward to reduce battery waste & lower car production CO2.
additional_details:
Alternative fuels use current infrastructure, so more affordable for those on a low income. Making Batteries releases high emissions. Electric cars have impracticalities - long charging, lower range & fast charging leads to shorter battery life & expense.
EVs are heavy, tyres wear faster, more tyre particle dust & road damage.
Some can't charge near home. 
Biomethane is more biodiverse & can be made from waste reducing pollution.
